t: Psalm 102
The Lord’s Eternal Love
A Prayer of the afflicted, when he is overwhelmed and pours out his complaint before the Lord.
Hear*pn my prayer, O Lord,*s And*ld let my cry come to You.
Do*ld not hide Your face from me in the day of my trouble; Incline*ld Your ear to me; In*ld the day that I call, answer me speedily.
For*ln my days are consumed like smoke, And*ld my bones are burned like a hearth.
My*ld heart is stricken and withered like grass, So*ld that I forget to eat my bread.
Because*ld of the sound of my groaning My*ld bones cling to my skin.
I*ld am like a pelican of the wilderness; I*ld am like an owl of the desert.
I*ld lie awake, And*ld am like a sparrow alone on the housetop.
My*ln enemies reproach me all day long; Those*ld who deride me swear an oath against me.
For*ld I have eaten ashes like bread, And*ld mingled my drink with weeping,
Because*ld of Your indignation and Your wrath; For*ld You have lifted me up and cast me away.
My*ld days are*i like a shadow that lengthens, And*ld I wither away like grass.
But*ln You, O Lord,*s shall endure forever, And*ld the remembrance of Your name to all generations.
You*ld will arise and*i have mercy on Zion; For*ld the time to favor her, Yes,*ld the set time, has come.
For*ld Your servants take pleasure in her stones, And*ld show favor to her dust.
So*ld the nations shall fear the name of the Lord,*s And*ld all the kings of the earth Your glory.
For*ld the Lord*s shall build up Zion; He*ld shall appear in His glory.
He*ld shall regard the prayer of the destitute, And*ld shall not despise their prayer.
This*ln will be written for the generation to come, That*ld a people yet to be created may praise the Lord.*s
For*ld He looked down from the height of His sanctuary; From*ld heaven the Lord*s viewed the earth,
To*ld hear the groaning of the prisoner, To*ld release those appointed to death,
To*ld declare the name of the Lord*s in Zion, And*ld His praise in Jerusalem,
When*ld the peoples are gathered together, And*ld the kingdoms, to serve the Lord.*s
He*ln weakened my strength in the way; He*ld shortened my days.
I*ld said, “O my God, Do*ld not take me away in the midst of my days; Your*ld years are*i throughout all generations.
Of*ld old You laid the foundation of the earth, And*ld the heavens are*i the work of Your hands.
They*ld will perish, but You will endure; Yes,*ld they will all grow old like a garment; Like*ld a cloak You will change them, And*ld they will be changed.
But*ld You are*i the same, And*ld Your years will have no end.
The*ld children of Your servants will continue, And*ld their descendants will be established before You.”
